ai-ud7.10:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-ud7.10:1.3_0: Now at that time, while King Udena was visiting a park, his royal compound burned down. Five hundred women died, with Queen Sāmāvatī at their head.
ai-ud7.10:2.1_0: Then several mendicants robed up in the morning and, taking their bowls and robes, entered Kosambi for alms.
ai-ud7.10:2.2_0: Then, after the meal, when they returned from alms-round, they went up to the Buddha.
ai-ud7.10:2.2_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-ud7.10:2.4_0: “Sir, while King Udena was visiting a park, his royal compound burned down. Five hundred women died, with Queen Sāmāvatī at their head.
ai-ud7.10:2.5_0: “Sir, where have those laywomen been reborn in the next life?”
ai-ud7.10:3.1_0: “Among those laywomen there were stream-enterers, once-returners, and non-returners.
ai-ud7.10:3.2_0: None of those laywomen died without some fruit of the practice.”
ai-ud7.10:4.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud7.10:5.1_0: “The world is caught up in delusion,
ai-ud7.10:5.2_0: but is looked on as making sense.
ai-ud7.10:5.3_0: The fool caught up in attachment
ai-ud7.10:5.6_0: who knows and sees, there is nothing.”
ai-ud7.10:6.3_0: There are ascetics who have transcended proliferation,
ai-ud7.10:6.5_0: The seventh sub-chapter on lying is finished.
